title: Match Bases and Solve for x
text: Since $$3*\log_{6}\left(x\right)=\log_{6}\left(x^3\right)=\log_{6}\left(64\right)$$ have the same bases both sides, we can take out the logarithm and get $$x^3=64$$. Solve for $$x^3=64$$ which gives $$x=4$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, b can not be negative. 4 is non negative. Therefore $$x=4$$ is the only solution for this equation.
